section.title: Adding Business Support
section.para: Business support includes any legal release notes, software release notes, custom help files in HTML and miscellaneous files. You can also include miscellaneous files in the release that are oversized or that perform a specialized function.

section.title: Adding appliance release files
section.para: To add files for release, use the release-rpm TLE. The release-rpm/eula element includes one end-user license agreement (EULA) file, while the release-rpm/html element includes HTML help files. You can add more release documentation, such as release notes, using the release-rpm/doc element. The release-rpm/files element can include additional files necessary for installation, such as additional kickstart files. All of these files are ready for release.

The example below demonstrates how to take a source document, located in the /home/spin/examples/ directory, rename it using the /@destname attribute, store it at another location using the /@destdir attribute and assign the user access level with the /@mode attribute. Note that many help systems require an index.html file.

informalexample.programlisting:
<release-rpm>
<!-- README, CONFIG and TEST documents for Samba --> <doc mode="644" destdir="/var/doc/samba-example" destname="README"> /home/spin/examples/SAMBA-README </doc> <doc mode="644" destdir="/var/doc/samba-example" destname="CONFIG"> /home/spin/examples/SAMBA-CONFIG </doc> <doc mode="644" destdir="/var/doc/samba-example" destname="TEST"> /home/spin/examples/SAMBA-TEST </doc>
<!-- End User License Agreement --> <eula mode="644" destdir="/var/doc/samba-example" destname="EULA"> /home/spin/examples/SAMBA-EULA </eula>
<!-- Default HTML page upon install of target system --> <html mode="644" destdir="/var/doc/samba-example" destname="index.html"> /home/spin/examples/samba-index.html </html>
</release-rpm>

section.para: When installing the appliance on the client system, there are four key paths for documentation or files you may provide, as listed in the table below. The variable $NAME is the appliance name, and $VERSION is the appliance's version; both values are specified in the main TLE.

table.title: Default Directory Structure on the Client System

row.entry: Path for release documentation in release-rpm/doc.
Path for EULA documentation in release-rpm/eula.
Path for release files in release-rpm/files.
Path for HTML documentation in release-rpm/html.

section.para: When creating the release rpms, normally files are copied onto all media; large files could take up a lot of disk space. To avoid this, include a file on a single disk media or at the root of the published appliance directory using the release-files TLE. You may also want to include additional files, such as the kickstart files.
